column4: I am tryint to install testdisk using the Ubuntu Software center and for the last hour it has been hung up in the applying changes. Ideas on how to get this package installed
just Ubuntu software center, should I use synaptic instead?
no, just asking because USC will hang if another package manageris open
no no other one is open
maybe it's process is hang?  system >> admin >> system monitor > processes
which process am I looking for?
ok, done, now how do I get this package to install properly?
you can try from a terminal: sudo apt-get install <package>
says another process is using dpkg, but I killed them
cant find anoything using dpkg, but still it wont install
hmm...i would probably log out/in to be sure
but will logging out and back in killl the process psaux|grep dpkg gives me a runing process trying to install testdisk still
see, you are more advanced than me :)  just suggesting what i would try at this point
amin ilessthan3ubuntu already said port 22, no?
